raw_text: Theuse of predicate-argument structure has been explored by Ponzetto and Strube (2006b; 2006a)
clean_text: The use of predicate-argument structure has been explored by Ponzetto and Strube (2006b; 2006a).

citing_paper_authors: Joseph, Irwin | Mamoru, Komachi | Yuji, Matsumoto
raw_text: This last conjecture is somewhat validated by Ponzetto and Strube (2006b), who reported that including predicate argument pairs as features improved the performance of a co reference resolver
clean_text: This last conjecture is somewhat validated by Ponzetto and Strube (2006b), who reported that including predicate argument pairs as features improved the performance of a coreference resolver.

citing_paper_authors: Yuval, Marton | Saif, Mohammad | Philip, Resnik
raw_text: Also, on WS-353, our hybrid sense-filtered variants and word-cos-ll obtained a correlation score higher than published results using WordNet-based measures (JarmaszandSzpakowicz, 2003) (.33 to .35) and Wikipedia based methods (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006) (.19 to .48); and very close to the results obtained by thesaurus-based (Jarmasz and Szpakowicz, 2003) (.55) and LSA-based methods (Finkelstein et al, 2002) (.56)
clean_text: Also, on WS-353, our hybrid sense-filtered variants and word-cos-ll obtained a correlation score higher than published results using WordNet-based measures (Jarmasz and Szpakowicz, 2003) (.33 to .35) and Wikipedia based methods (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006) (.19 to .48); and very close to the results obtained by thesaurus-based (Jarmasz and Szpakowicz, 2003) (.55) and LSA-based methods (Finkelstein et al, 2002) (.56).

raw_text: However, the use of related verbs is similar in spirit to BeanandRiloff? s (2004) use of patterns for inducing contextual role knowledge, and the use of semantic roles is also discussed in Ponzetto and Strube (2006)
clean_text: However, the use of related verbs is similar in spirit to Bean and Riloff's (2004) use of patterns for inducing contextual role knowledge, and the use of semantic roles is also discussed in Ponzetto and Strube (2006).

raw_text: Note that there has beena recent surge of interest in extracting world knowledge from on line encyclopedias such as Wikipedia (e.g., Ponzetto and Strube (2006, 2007), Poesio et al
clean_text: Note that there has been a recent surge of interest in extracting world knowledge from online encyclopedias such as Wikipedia (e.g., Ponzetto and Strube (2006, 2007), Poesio et al).

raw_text: Our baseline co reference system implements the standard machine learning approach to co reference resolution (see Ng and Cardie (2002b), Ponzetto and Strube (2006), Yang and Su (2007), for instance), which consists of probabilistic classification and clustering, as described below
clean_text: Our baseline coreference system implements the standard machine learning approach to coreference resolution (see Ng and Cardie (2002b), Ponzetto and Strube (2006), Yang and Su (2007), for instance), which consists of probabilistic classification and clustering, as described below.

raw_text: Traditional learning-based co reference resolvers operate by training a model for classifying whether two mentions are co-referring or not (e.g., Soon et al (2001), Ng and Cardie (2002b), Kehler et al (2004), Ponzetto and Strube (2006))
clean_text: Traditional learning-based coreference resolvers operate by training a model for classifying whether two mentions are co-referring or not (e.g., Soon et al (2001), Ng and Cardie (2002b), Kehler et al (2004), Ponzetto and Strube (2006)).

citing_paper_authors: Sameer S., Pradhan | Lance A., Ramshaw | Mitchell P., Marcus | Martha, Palmer | Ralph M., Weischedel | Nianwen, Xue
raw_text: Given that WordNet is a static ontology and as such has limitation on coverage, more recently, there have been successful attempts to utilize in formation from much larger, collaboratively built resources such as Wikipedia (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006)
clean_text: Given that WordNet is a static ontology and as such has limitation on coverage, more recently, there have been successful attempts to utilize information from much larger, collaboratively built resources such as Wikipedia (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006).

raw_text: The use of semantic knowledge for co reference resolution has been studied before in a number of works, among them (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006), (Bengtson and Roth, 2008), (Lee et al, 2011), and (Rahman and Ng, 2011)
clean_text: The use of semantic knowledge for coreference resolution has been studied before in a number of works, among them (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006), (Bengtson and Roth, 2008), (Lee et al, 2011), and (Rahman and Ng, 2011).

citing_paper_authors: Xingwei, Liao | Xinxin, Li | Xuan, Wang
raw_text: III and Marcu, 2005)  Grammatical features: pronoun, demonstrative noun phrase, embedded noun, gender agreement, number agreement (Soon et al, 2001)  Syntactic features: same head, maximal NP, syntactic path (Yang et al, 2006)  Semantic features: semantic class agreement, governing verb and its grammatical role ,predicate (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006) For English, the number agreement and gender agreement features can be obtained through the gender corpus provided
clean_text: Semantic features: semantic class agreement, governing verb and its grammatical role, predicate (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006) For English, the number agreement and gender agreement features can be obtained through the gender corpus provided.

raw_text: Recently, Ponzetto and Strube (2006) suggest to mine semantic relatedness from Wikipedia, which can deal with the data sparseness problem suffered by using WordNet
clean_text: Recently, Ponzetto and Strube (2006) suggest to mine semantic relatedness from Wikipedia, which can deal with the data sparseness problem suffered by using WordNet.

raw_text: Some researchers simply use the first sense (Soon et al, 2001) or all possible senses (PonzettoandStrube, 2006a), while others overcome this problem with word sense disambiguation (Nicolae and Nicolae, 2006)
clean_text: Some researchers simply use the first sense (Soon et al, 2001) or all possible senses (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006a), while others overcome this problem with word sense disambiguation (Nicolae and Nicolae, 2006).

raw_text: Knowledge has also been mined from Wikipedia for measuring the semantic relatedness of two NPs, NPj and NPk (PonzettoandStrube (2006a; 2007)), such as: whether NPj/kap pears in the first paragraph of the Wiki page that has NPk/j as the title or in the list of categories to which this page belongs, and the degree of overlap between the two pages that have the two NPs as their titles (see Poesio et al (2007) for other uses of encyclopedic knowledge for co reference resolution)
clean_text: Knowledge has also been mined from Wikipedia for measuring the semantic relatedness of two NPs, NPj and NPk (Ponzetto and Strube (2006a; 2007)).

raw_text: Contextual roles (Bean and Riloff, 2004), semantic relations (Ji et al, 2005), semantic roles (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006b; Kong et al, 2009), and animacy (Ora ?san and Evans, 2007) have also been exploited to improve co reference resolution
clean_text: Contextual roles (Bean and Riloff, 2004), semantic relations (Ji et al, 2005), semantic roles (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006b; Kong et al, 2009), and animacy (Orasan and Evans, 2007) have also been exploited to improve coreference resolution.

raw_text: We use Wikipedia differently from (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006) who focus on using WikiRelate, a Wikipedia-based relatedness metric (Strube and Ponzetto, 2006)
clean_text: We use Wikipedia differently from (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006) who focus on using WikiRelate, a Wikipedia-based relatedness metric (Strube and Ponzetto, 2006).

citing_paper_authors: Yu, Zhang | Sameer S., Pradhan | Alessandro, Moschitti | Nianwen, Xue | Olga, Uryupina
raw_text: Given that WordNet is a static ontology and as such has limitation on coverage, more recently, there have been successful attempts to utilize information from much larger, collaboratively built resources such asWikipedia (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006)

As a result, researchers have re-adopted the once-popular knowledge-rich approach ,investi gating a variety of semantic knowledge sources for common noun resolution, such as the semantic relations between two NPs (e.g., Ji et al (2005)), their semantic similarity as computed using WordNet (e.g., Poesio et al (2004)) or Wikipedia (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006), and the contextual role played by an NP (see Bean and Riloff (2004))
clean_text: As a result, researchers have re-adopted the once-popular knowledge-rich approach ,investigating a variety of semantic knowledge sources for common noun resolution, such as the semantic relations between two NPs (e.g., Ji et al (2005)), their semantic similarity as computed using WordNet (e.g., Poesio et al (2004)) or Wikipedia (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006), and the contextual role played by an NP (see Bean and Riloff (2004)).

raw_text: Following Ponzetto and Strube (2006), we consider an anaphoric reference, NPi, correctly resolved if NPiand its closest antecedent are in the same co refer ence chain in the resulting partition
clean_text: Following Ponzetto and Strube (2006), we consider an anaphoric reference, NPi, correctly resolved if NPi and its closest antecedent are in the same coreference chain in the resulting partition.

raw_text: Following previous work (e.g., Soon et al (2001) and Ponzetto and Strube (2006)), we generate training instances as follows: a positive instance is created for each anaphoric NP, NPj ,andits closest antecedent, NPi; and a negative instance is created for NPj paired with each of the interveningNPs, NPi+1, NPi+2,..., NPj? 1
clean_text: Following previous work (e.g., Soon et al (2001) and Ponzetto and Strube (2006)), we generate training instances as follows: a positive instance is created for each anaphoric NP, NPj, and its closest antecedent, NPi; and a negative instance is created for NPj paired with each of the intervening NPs, NPi+1, NPi+2,..., NPj-1.

citing_paper_authors: Luisa, Bentivogli | Pamela, Forner | Claudio, Giuliano | Alessandro, Marchetti | Emanuele, Pianta | Kateryna, Tymoshenko
raw_text: In alternative, it has been recently shown that Wikipedia can be a promising source of semantic knowledge for co reference resolution between nominals (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006)
clean_text: In alternative, it has been recently shown that Wikipedia can be a promising source of semantic knowledge for coreference resolution between nominals (Ponzetto and Strube, 2006).
